Detailed Description

Base Class for Manipulators.

The class Manipulator is the generic base class for all manipulators. It contains functionality to determine the current manipulator position, set the current manipulator position, specify setpoints, enable/disable the arm power, set the trajectory generator, use an external servo control.

The implementation for a specific manipulator is done in a derived class. The servo control implementation is up to this implementation. For example, the derived class could utilize a ServoControl object to control an open-architecture manipulator (this is what the class DefaultManipulator does), or just forward setpoints to a closed-architecture manipulator with a built-in servo control.

This class allows to associate a manipulator model and a trajectory generator with the manipulator object. The manipulator model should be used in a derived class for dynamic simulation and kinematics.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: Manipulator Classes
// Authors: Markus Loffler
// Start Date: Fri Nov 17 17:41:17 utc 2000
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: Manipulator.t.cpp
// Example program for the class Manipulator.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"
#include "ObjectManager.hpp"
#include "Manipulator.hpp"

 
 
//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);
  
  // Use the first manipulator specified in the global configuration
  // file.
  ObjectManager om;
  Manipulator *manipulator = om.createDerivedObject<Manipulator>();
  if (om.d_status.isStatusError())
  {
    cout << om.d_status.getMessageText() << endl;
    return -1;
  }
  
  int numJoints = manipulator->getNumJoints();
  
  cout << "Current Joint Position:" << endl;
  for (int i = 1; i <= numJoints; i++)
    cout << "Joint " << i << ": "
         << manipulator->getCurrentJointPosition(i) << endl;
    
  return 0;
}

Transform getCurrentEndEffectorTransform ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Determines the current end-effector transform. This is a convenience function that applies forward kinematics to the joint position returned by getCurrentJointPosition()

The current end-effector transform.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void getDefaultJointVelocity ( VectorBase<>& jointVelocity ) const [pure virtual]
 

Determines the default joint velocity of all joints. This velocity should reflect the optimal speed for the manipulator.

Parameters:
jointVelocity   The default joint velocity for all joints.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void getDefaultJointAcceleration ( VectorBase<>& jointAcceleration ) const [pure virtual]
 

Determines the default joint acceleration of all joints. This acceleration should reflect the optimal acceleration for the manipulator.

Parameters:
jointAcceleration   The default joint acceleration for all joints.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void calibrateJointPosition ( const VectorBase<>& jointPosition ) [pure virtual]
 

Calibrates the manipulator by defining a certain position to be the current position that the manipulator is in. The new position overwrites the current position. This function should not be called while the manipulator is in movement. When reimplementing this function, a derived class must assure that using this function does not result in undesired movements of the manipulator, i.e. any connected servo control must be informed about the calibration as well as trajectory generators, using the ServoControl::newManipulatorPosition() function.

Parameters:
jointPosition   New manipulator joint position.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator, and Puma560.

void setDesiredJointPosition ( const VectorBase<>& desiredJointPosition ) [pure virtual]
 

Sets a setpoint for the joint position. Note that this function must not be used to move the manipulator to a target position; rather, this function must be called at a certain frequency to create a smooth trajectory. To use the manipulator to a target position, a trajectory generator must be used.

Parameters:
desiredJointPosition   The desired joint position.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void setDesiredEndEffectorTransform ( Transform & desiredEndEffectorTransform ) [pure virtual]
 

Sets a setpoint for the end-effector transform. Note that this function must not be used to move the manipulator to a target position; rather, this function must be called at a certain frequency to create a smooth trajectory. To use the manipulator to a target position, a trajectory generator must be used.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void enableArmPower ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Enables the arm power of the manipulator. The arm power is enabled by default when the object is being constructed.

Note that some manipulators don't enable the arm power immediately (e.g., a call to enableArmPower() does not result in an immediate enabling of the arm power), for example, because they need user intervention (e.g., pressing the arm power button). Hence, use the function isArmPowerEnabled() to check if the arm power has really been enabled yet.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void disableArmPower ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Disables the arm power of the manipulator. The arm power is disabled automatically when the object is being deleted or shutdown.

Note that some manipulators don't disable the arm power immediately (e.g., the WAM might go into a damping mode and wait until the arm drops slowly to a stable position). Hence, use the function isArmPowerEnabled() to check if the arm power has really been disabled yet.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

bool isArmPowerEnabled ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Determines if the arm power is currently enabled.

Returns:
true: The arm power is enabled, false: The arm power is disabled.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

VectorBase * createJointVector ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Creates a vector that has as many elements as the manipulator has joints. The vector is allocated with "new", hence, it needs to be deleted with "delete" by the user.

Returns:
A pointer to the vector.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void setTeachModeOn ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Switches to the teach mode of the manipulator. This teach mode allows the user to move the manipulator manually in the workspace, e.g., using a zero gravity control or a joystick.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void setTeachModeOff ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Leaves the teach mode and goes back to normal control mode.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

bool isTeachModeOn ( ) [pure virtual]
 

Determines if the manipulator is in teach mode.

Returns:
true: The manipulator is in teach mode, false: The manipulator is in normal control mode.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void setManipulatorModel ( ManipulatorModel & manipulatorModel ) [virtual]
 

Associates a object of a derived class of ManipulatorModel with the Manipulator object. This object can be used for kinematic operations, dynamic operations, manipulator configurations and parameters.

This class just stores an internal pointer that can be retrieved with getManipulatorModel(). A derived class should first call the setManipulatorModel() function of the parent class and then add additional functionality.

Parameters:
manipulatorModel   A pointer to an object of a class that is derived from the class ManipulatorModel.

ManipulatorModel * getManipulatorModel ( ) const
 

Returns the associated manipulator model.

Returns:
A pointer to the manipulator model.

void setTrajectoryGenerator ( TrajectoryGenerator & trajectoryGenerator ) [virtual]
 

Associates a trajectory generator with the manipulator. The manipulator object uses this trajectory generator to determine desired trajectory for the manipulator.

This class stores an internal pointer that can be retrieved with getTrajectoryGenerator(). It also calls the reset() function of the trajectory generator.

A derived class should first call the setTrajectoryGenerator() function of the parent class then add additional functionality.

Parameters:
trajectoryGenerator   A pointer to an object of a class that is derived from the class TrajectoryGenerator.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void setNoTrajectoryGenerator ( ) [virtual]
 

Removes the trajectory generator associated with the manipulator. The manipulator object will follow the trajectory specified with setDesiredJointPosition().

This class just sets the internal pointer to zero. A derived class should first call the setTrajectoryGeneratorOff() function of the parent class then add additional functionality.

TrajectoryGenerator * getTrajectoryGenerator ( ) const
 

Returns the associated trajectory generator.

Returns:
A pointer to the trajectory generator, or zero, if no trajectory generator is associated.

void createControlPanel ( bool realizeFlag = true ) [virtual]
 

Creates the control panel for manipulators. Adds the display of the current joint position.

Parameters:
realizeFlag   If true, realize the control panel.

Reimplemented from PhysicalObject.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void updateGUI ( ) [protected, virtual]
 

Updates the GUI.

Reimplemented from PhysicalObject.

Reimplemented in DefaultManipulator.

void create3DModel ( ) [protected, virtual]
 

This function creates the 3D model of the manipulator like described in PhysicalObject::get3DModel(). For the animation of the manipulator, it looks for rotation nodes or translation nodes with the name "joint<num>", i.e. "joint1", "joint2", etc.

See also:
PhysicalObject::create3DModel()

Reimplemented from PhysicalObject.

void update3DModel ( ) [protected, virtual]
 

Updates the manipulator 3D model with the current joint position.

Reimplemented from PhysicalObject.
